#summary What Virtual Project is.

= Virtual Project =

An Eclipse project that is created by [Debugger] for each debug session (called launch in Eclipse) and gets deleted once the debug session is dismissed. The virtual project can be found among other regular projects. Since [Release_0_2_0 release 0.2.0] it looks as a folder icon with a small [http://www.chromium.org Chromium] logo on it. The project serves as a container for !JavaScript scripts downloaded from a remote VM. Those scripts are never saved in any files and get gone together with the project.

== Why do we need it? ==

For a languages like C++ or Java all the source files are gathered at developer's box. Quite contrary for JavaScript case all sources are gathered in running VM (including those generated on-the-fly). That's why !JavaScript debugger first has to download them to user environment. Virtual Project is a storage where Debugger puts them to.

== Virtual Project vs. local files from workspace ==
